abstract: Both Fresno, Calif., and Santa Fe, N.M., face dire water shortages, but only one has embraced tiered pricing, where heavy users pay much more per gallon.
snippet: Both Fresno, Calif., and Santa Fe, N.M., face dire water shortages, but only one has embraced tiered pricing, where heavy users pay much more per gallon.
lead_paragraph: FRESNO, Calif. — When residents of this parched California city opened their water bills for April, they got what Mayor Ashley Swearengin called “a shock to the system.”

headline.main: Water Pricing in Two Thirsty Cities: In One, Guzzlers Pay More, and Use Less
headline.print_headline: Two Thirsty Cities: In One, Guzzlers Pay More, and Use Less
